Subject: Use. hones iff whil ls

It has been noticed that the ASG staff including the senior officers
make frequent use of their cell phones during duty hours which results in
their attention being diverted from serious work. Quite a few of these
calls’ are related to the requests for facilitation at the airports, which is not
the charter of the ASG and has created avoidable problems for the CISF.

2. It has, therefore, been decided that the ASG staff will not carry cell
phones while on duty. All Gazetted officers and supervisory. officers: will
be carrying RT sets on ‘listening mode’. Essential messages will be
passed only on the RT set through the operational control room.
Personal staff will be suitably instructed by the Commandants/CASOs to
pass urgent operational messages to the Commandant/CASO or other
senior officers on the RT set through the Ops Control» Room.
Commandant Incharge of the unit may keep a cell phone with him but it
should remain on the silent/vibrator mode for answering emergent calls
from the DiG/Airport, IG/AS, FHQ Control Room and the: DG's office.
Inspecting officers will ensure strict compliance of these directions.
